issue.title: Don't update working copy of the repository

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Will help with #1407.

Depends on #1433 and #1481.

body: We should be able to do this with try too.

rename.from: For autoland patches, instead of getting automation relevance and raw patches, just pull
rename.to: Instead of getting automation relevance and applying raw patches, just pull

issue.title: Check if the Mercurial operations we perform in clean are all needed

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
For example, in `repository.apply_stack` we currently do:
- hg.revert(repo_dir, all=True)
- hglib.util.cmdbuilder(b"strip", rev=b"roots(outgoing())", force=True, backup=False)
- hg.update(base, clean=True)

Are all these operations needed?

issue.title: Don't hit hgmo to get automationrelevance for a given push

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
If we do #1433, instead of getting automationrelevance from a remote hgmo repo, we can get it from a locally running hgmo.
Or, we could try to add a command to version-control-tools to get automationrelevance without running the server.

Could help with #1422.

issue.title: Instead of getting automation relevance and applying raw patches for try, just pull

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body: We did it for autoland (#1433), but for try we can't yet (since there are too many heads, pulling from try is super slow).

body: I've filed #1481 for try, as it's not yet feasible (too slow).

issue.title: Speed-up test scheduling classification

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Some logs from Heroku:
```
2020-03-20T18:35:14.523697+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:35:14,523:INFO:rq.worker:default: bugbug_http.models.schedule_tests('integration/autoland', 'e08a5c2df0476fe785f5524f5b0552320b5ca8f2') (36f29d2edefb4485a5261e8f51d00731)
2020-03-20T18:35:46.210166+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:35:46,209:INFO:bugbug.repository:Loaded 1 patches for the stack
2020-03-20T18:35:46.210285+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:35:46,210:INFO:bugbug.repository:Updating /tmp/bugbug-hg to tip
2020-03-20T18:35:55.211602+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:35:55,211:INFO:bugbug.repository:Stack applied successfully on tip
2020-03-20T18:36:01.514406+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:36:01,514:INFO:bugbug.rust_code_analysis_server:Rust code analysis server is ready to accept queries
2020-03-20T18:36:05.409288+00:00 app[worker.1]: 
2020-03-20T18:36:31.950905+00:00 app[worker.1]: 
2020-03-20T18:36:31.950915+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:36:31,950:INFO:root:Recreating the 'testlabelselect' model in cache
2020-03-20T18:36:31.973006+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:36:31,972:INFO:root:Lookup model in testlabelselectmodel
2020-03-20T18:37:01.703737+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:37:01,703:INFO:root:Recreating the 'testgroupselect' model in cache
2020-03-20T18:37:01.704012+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:37:01,703:INFO:root:Lookup model in testgroupselectmodel
2020-03-20T18:37:11.985366+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:37:11,985:INFO:rq.worker:default: Job OK (36f29d2edefb4485a5261e8f51d00731)
2020-03-20T18:37:11.985962+00:00 app[worker.1]: 2020-03-20 18:37:11,985:INFO:rq.worker:Result is kept for 500 seconds
```

It is taking 2 minutes.
The actual classification is taking 40 seconds.
We'd need to add a bit more logging to figure out where we are spending the most time.
